decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing Kess, Dissident Mage's ability to cast spells from the graveyard to control the game. It includes a wide range of instant and sorcery spells to disrupt opponent's strategies, protect Kess, and generate card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's tempo and color requirements, ensuring consistency in casting spells. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil adds additional control elements and win conditions. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient removal, counterspells, and card draw, ultimately dominating the battlefield and dictating the pace of the game.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, card advantage, and powerful enchantments. Zur the Enchanter serves as the commander, allowing access to key enchantments like Solitary Confinement, Necropotence, and Detention Sphere. The deck is filled with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, Fatal Push, and Damnation to deal with threats on the board. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Liliana of the Veil, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria for additional card advantage and control. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and eventually win through incremental advantage provided by high-impact enchantments and powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently utilize land cards and graveyard recursion in order to achieve a powerful and consistent combo with The Gitrog Monster as the commander. By sacrificing lands and drawing cards with The Gitrog Monster, the deck aims to generate advantage and value to set up game-winning combos such as Splendid Reclamation, Scapeshift, and Life from the Loam. The deck also includes control elements like Thoughtseize and removal spells to disrupt opponents' strategies. With a solid mana base and a variety of tutoring options, the deck seeks to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Goblin creatures and powerful burn spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to flood the board with Goblins, using cards like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Matron to bring in more creatures and cards like Krenko, Mob Boss to generate tokens. The burn spells, such as Lightning Bolt and Fiery Confluence, provide reach to finish off opponents or get rid of problematic creatures. With cards like Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief providing buffs to the Goblins, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of powerful spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up advantageous board states. Through the use of cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Counterspell, and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to maintain control over the battlefield and the opponent's resources. Cards like Aminatou, the Fateshifter and Venser, Shaper Savant provide additional value by manipulating cards and bouncing problematic permanents. With a combination of efficient removal, card draw, and counter spells, the deck seeks to outmaneuver the opponent and gradually establish dominance, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and strategy.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl, Green Sun's Zenith, and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, to play high-impact creatures and spells ahead of schedule. Nissa, Vastwood Seer helps with ramp and card advantage, while cards like Avenger of Zendikar, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Sylvan Primordial provide powerful threats. The deck also includes strong utility cards like Fauna Shaman, Reclamation Sage, and Phyrexian Revoker to deal with opposing threats. With a focus on controlling the board with cards like Wasteland, Tectonic Edge, and Acidic Slime, the goal is to overpower the opponent with big creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan, or disrupt their strategy with cards like Winter Orb and Karn Liberated.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Selvala, Heart of the Wilds' ability to generate mana by playing big creatures and combo pieces to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Devoted Druid, Tooth and Nail, Phyrexian Dreadnought, Birthing Pod, and Eldritch Evolution, the deck aims to assemble powerful combos and threats. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Primeval Titan, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Emrakul, the Promised End for their devastating impact on the game. With an abundance of mana dorks, ramp spells, and utility creatures, the deck looks to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out the game with powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth.

This deck focuses on using the powerful partner commanders, Will Kenrith and Rowan Kenrith, to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy using a UR color combination. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, burn spells, card draw, and versatile threats to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The goal is to control the board while dealing damage efficiently and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like True-Name Nemesis, The Locust God, and powerful planeswalkers like Ral, Izzet Viceroy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own strategy. Additionally, the deck includes various land destruction spells and utility lands to further disrupt the opponent's mana base.
